008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.image;
010
011import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
012import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
015import imagingbook.common.image.access.ImageAccessor;
016import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
017
018/**
019 * This class defines methods to perform arbitrary geometric transformations
020 * on images. The geometric transformation (mapping) must be specified at
021 * construction.
022 * The specified geometric mapping is supposed to be INVERTED, i.e. transforming
023 * <strong>target to source</strong> coordinates!
024 * For reading pixel values (from the source image) the out-of-bounds strategy and
025 * pixel interpolation method can be specified.
026 * All methods work for both scalar-valued and color images.
027 * 
028 * @author WB
029 * @version 2021/08/27
030 * @version 2022/09/16 revised
031 * 
032 * @see ImageAccessor
033 * @see Mapping2D
034 */
035public class ImageMapper {
036        
037        /** Default out-of-bounds strategy (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}). */
038        public static OutOfBoundsStrategy DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy = OutOfBoundsStrategy.NearestBorder;       
039        
040        /** Default pixel interpolation method (see {@link InterpolationMethod}). */
041        public static InterpolationMethod DefaultInterpolationMethod = InterpolationMethod.Bicubic;     
042        
043        private final OutOfBoundsStrategy obs;
044        private final InterpolationMethod ipm;
045        private final Mapping2D mapping;
046        
047        /**
048         * Constructor - creates a new {@link ImageMapper} with the specified geometric mapping.
049         * The default pixel interpolation method is used
050         * (see {@link DefaultInterpolationMethod}).
051         * 
052         * @param targetToSourceMapping the geometric (target to source) transformation
053         */
054        public ImageMapper(Mapping2D targetToSourceMapping) {
055                this(targetToSourceMapping, DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy, DefaultInterpolationMethod);
056        }
057
058        /**
059         * Constructor - creates a new {@link ImageMapper} with the specified geometric mapping,
060         * out-of-bounds strategy and pixel interpolation method.
061         * 
062         * @param targetToSourceMapping the geometric (target to source) transformation
063         * @param obs the out-of-bounds strategy (affects source image only)
064         * @param ipm the pixel interpolation method
065         */
066        public ImageMapper(Mapping2D targetToSourceMapping, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
067                this.mapping = targetToSourceMapping;
068                this.obs = obs;
069                this.ipm = ipm;
070        }
071        
072        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
073        
074        /**
075         * Destructively transforms the passed image using this geometric
076         * mapping and the specified pixel interpolation method.
077         * 
078         * @param ip target image to which this mapping is applied
079         */
080        public void map(ImageProcessor ip) {
081                // make a temporary copy of the image:
082                ImageProcessor source = ip.duplicate();
083                ImageProcessor target = ip;
084                map(source, target);
085                source = null;
086        }
087        
088        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
089        
090        /**
091         * Transforms the source image to the target image using this geometric
092         * mapping and the specified pixel interpolation method. Note that source
093         * and target must be different images!
094         * The geometric mapping is supposed to be INVERTED, i.e. transforming
095         * target to source image coordinates!
096         * 
097         * @param source input image (not modified)
098         * @param target output image (modified)
099         */
100        public void map(ImageProcessor source, ImageProcessor target) {
101                if (target == source) {
102                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("source and target image must not be the same!");
103                }
104                ImageAccessor sourceAcc = ImageAccessor.create(source, obs, ipm);
105                ImageAccessor targetAcc = ImageAccessor.create(target);
106                map(sourceAcc, targetAcc);
107        }
108
109        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
110
111        /**
112         * Transforms the source image to the target image using this geometric
113         * mapping and the specified pixel interpolation method.
114         * The two images are passed as instances of {@link ImageAccessor}.
115         * Note that source and target must be different images!
116         * The geometric mapping is supposed to be INVERTED, i.e. transforming
117         * target to source image coordinates.
118         * Access to source pixels is controlled by the out-of-bounds strategy and pixel
119         * interpolation method settings of the source {@link ImageAccessor}
120         * (the corresponding settings of this {@link ImageAccessor} are ignored).
121         * 
122         * @param sourceAcc {@link ImageAccessor} for the source image
123         * @param targetAcc {@link ImageAccessor} for the target image
124         */
125        public void map(ImageAccessor sourceAcc, ImageAccessor targetAcc) {
126                if (targetAcc.getProcessor() == sourceAcc.getProcessor()) {
127                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Source and target image must not be the same!");
128                }
129                ImageProcessor target = targetAcc.getProcessor();
130                final int w = target.getWidth();
131                final int h = target.getHeight();
132                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
133                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
134                                Pnt2d sourcePt = this.mapping.applyTo(PntInt.from(u, v));
135                                float[] val = sourceAcc.getPix(sourcePt.getX(), sourcePt.getY());
136                                targetAcc.setPix(u, v, val);
137                        }
138                }
139        }
140
141}
